Description: Egyptian terracotta mould-made figure plaque of Greek amphora in front of an altar. May have been left side of a larger relief plaque group. Pale red brown fabric with black core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organic and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably local fabric. Figure plaque of Late Period in both style and technique, probably depicting imported Greek amphora with flat handles bowed neck and carinated shoulders. See also NA366 in Cambridge also from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.139) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 97, no. 358)
